entry.title: bug #298 (submitted): GFD 194 specifies openMonitoringSession (in string contact) as contact stri...
entry.content:
drmaa2_msession drmaa2_open_msession (const char * session_name );

MonitoringSession openMonitoringSession (in string contact );

Session name as parameter does not make sense.

entry.title: feature #142 (submitted): make schemas / WSDL available via http://schemas.ogf.org/
bug #103 (proposed): finalize function needed to prevent minor memory leaks
entry.content:
We provide the last error as text and number. The error must be execution thread related.
When implementing as thread local storage the destructor for the main thread must be called
some-when. But it is not specified how long the error must be available. Hence the
error is stored until the application is quited. This "memory leak" is very minor since
it is just one string (we need allocated strings because of dynamic error messages).

Nevertheless memory leaking checking tools generating issues which really should be
prevented.

Just to be noted so that can be handled by language bindings on the top maybe.

entry.title: bug #91 (submitted): Incoherence between bnf rules and example in the HTTP rendering
entry.content:
A lot of examples in the "RESTful HTTP Rendering" document are ending with a trailing ";". In particular, the example about Category or Link.
But when you look at the bnf definition in page 19 and 20, a ";" can only appears between 2 actual category-value or link-value.
Then, inside the http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt, section 4.2, there is nothing that introduce an extra ";" and the end of message header.

Can you tell me if i missed something in the document ?.

feature #79 (submitted): Contextualization of compute entity resources
draft #69 (submitted): Link / noReturnTraffic
entry.content:
The current description of the noReturnTraffic parameter of a Link is somewhat cryptic:

noReturnTraffic. A value of true changes the definition of Link to: data transport from each sources to all sinks, except that there is no data transport from a source to a sink if the source and sink are grouped together in a BidirectionalPort group. The default value of noReturnTraffic is false.

This should be updated to explain better what it means.

entry.title: document #60 (author action): OCCI Monitoring
entry.content: This document describes an interface based on OCCI for the definition of a monitoring infrastructure.
